noun.description: A conception of or belief about something.
examples: children have different notions about the roles of their parents
I had no notion of what her words meant

noun.description: An impulse or desire, especially one of a whimsical kind.
examples: she had a notion to call her friend at work

noun.description: Items used in sewing, such as buttons, pins, and hooks.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin notio(n-) idea, from notus known, past participle of noscere.
